intro: Grewia acuminata var. grandis, commonly known as the large-fruited wild mangosteen, is a shrub or small tree native to tropical regions of Africa. It is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are usually ovate to elliptical in shape. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in terminal panicles, followed by edible, fleshy fruits with a sweet and tangy flavor. The fruits are typically 2–5 cm in diameter and have a thin, leathery skin. This species is often found in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade.
